page.title: 17Religion in Pontyclun
page.content: Pontyclun has four Non-conformist Chapels and an Anglican Church. Bethel English Church(146 members) built in 1880 was formerly (1876) held in a terraced cottage alongside the railway line. Tabernacl Welsh Congregational Chapel(25 members) was built in 1892.The chapel is of dressed stone and seats 300 people. The Methodist Church was built in 1899 and first belonged to the Bible Christians.It later became the United Methodist Church and in 1936 the Methodist Church. Hope Presbyterian Church of Wales(73 members) was built in 1910.There were 22 members.The building cost Â£800. Saint Paul's Anglican Church,built in 1895,belongs to the Province of the Church in Wales.In 1926 Pontyclun and Talygarn became a parish.
